title: Get help with child arrangements
introduction:
You and the other parent may need to agree child arrangements (also known as custody) if you divorce or separate. For example, you may need to decide where your children will live and how much time they spend with each of you.

There are ways you can both prepare before you begin negotiating arrangements. This guide contains information about your legal rights, where to get support and how to involve your children. It also explains the different ways you can reach an agreement, for example by attending mediation or using a parenting plan.
